summary.title: Zeke Web Application
summary.description:
StellarPay Digital Banking is a fast-growing fintech company that is developing a web-based digital payment platform to provide secure and seamless financial transactions for its customers. This platform will enable users to create accounts, link bank cards, send and receive money, pay for goods and services, and manage their financial transactions in real time.

Due to the handling of sensitive financial data, including personal identification details, bank account information, transaction logs, and API communications with payment gateways, StellarPay is prioritising security before launching the platform. The company has decided to conduct a threat modelling exercise to proactively identify and mitigate potential cyber threats before deployment.

threats.title: Threat 1
threats.mitigation: Implement MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication), rate-limiting login attempts, use secure password storage

threats.title: Threat 2
threats.description: (API key/data leaks) Use token expiration, encrypt data in transit, limit response data.
threats.mitigation: Use TLS with integrity checks, mutual TLS between services, detect protocol anomalies

threats.title: Threat 3
threats.description: with transactions Use database constraints, transactional integrity checks, and cryptographic signing.
threats.mitigation: use database constraints, transactional integrity checks and cryptographic signing

threats.title: Threat 4
threats.description: Validate recipients before sending, tokenize sensitive data in messages.
threats.mitigation: digitally sign all notifications, verify integrity before delivery
